thread.title_full: Return from paradise: how not to be hated at work | The Sunday Times

author: Duncan Craig
title: Return from paradise: how not to be hated at work
text:
DON’T try to accentuate your tan with lotions and potions, or by suddenly dressing like Kanye. Yes, head-to-toe white brings out your holiday colour. It’s also ridiculous. DO use conversational restraint. “How was it?” isn’t a question. It’s a way of stopping our mouths from articulating what we’re thinking. Which is... unprintable.
DON’T eulogise about holiday friends. Carol and John weren’t “legends”. They were time-fillers. Everyone’s interesting when you’re tanked up on 11am cocktails.
DO tell us about the rubbish bits. The dodgy tummies. The flight delays. The pending divorce.
DON’T attack your work with a renewed vigour. It draws attention to your holiday. Focus on steady mediocrity.
DO keep shtoom on cost. It’s the ultimate no-win. Expensive? Flash git. Only a couple of hundred quid more than Center Parcs? Rub it in, why don’t you?
